intro: Bobea hexasperma, commonly known as the six-ribbed bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive yellow or orange coloration. The seeds are enclosed in slender, elongated pods, which split open when mature to release the seeds.
